metadata.name: Bypass UAC via WSReset.exe
metadata.comment: Detects use of WSReset.exe to bypass User Account Control (UAC). Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\\\wsreset.exe')) AND NOT (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\conhost.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('conhost.exe')))

output.summary: Detects use of WSReset.exe to bypass User Account Control (UAC). Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.

metadata.objective: False positive: Unknown sub processes of Wsreset.exe References: https://eqllib.readthedocs.io/en/latest/analytics/532b5ed4-7930-11e9-8f5c-d46d6d62a49e.html, https://lolbas-project.github.io/lolbas/Binaries/Wsreset/, https://www.activecyber.us/activelabs/windows-uac-bypass, https://twitter.com/ReaQta/status/1222548288731217921
